title: Ticket #6786: notification on Error poorly documented
description:
Page 909 of the HTCondor 8.7.9 manual states 

If defined by Error, the owner will only be notified if the job terminates abnormally, (as defined by JobSuccessExitCode,
if defined) or if the job is placed on hold because of a failure, and not by user request

This differs from from the HTCondor 8.6.12 manual by the inclusion of the text surrounding JobSuccessExitCode. The meaning of JobSuccessExitCode is not defined anywhere in the manual and is undefined for all jobs in my 8.7.9 queue and condor_history. Even when one uses the submit command success_exit_code it remains undefined.

So, I think it's safe to say that there's a documentation bug here.

But, it does more or less behave as we want it to. For HTCondor 8.7.9, the behavior of Error includes when jobs exit by a code other than 0 or by the explicit value set by success_exit_code. What is less clear (from the text above) is whether it will continue the behavior of notification on abnormal termination (e.g. a segfault).

I'd much prefer to see text that was clearer ("this looks like a job for bulleted lists!") and relies only on classads / commands that exist. For example: 

If *set to* Error, the owner *will be notified* if the job terminates abnormally  (e.g. segfault), or if the job exits with a code other than that set by success_exit_code (default value of 0), or if the job is placed on hold by HTCondor due to a failure / cgroups limit rather than through use of the command condor_hold.

Obviously the documentation should reflect your intent and the actual behavior. So, please fix as you see fit.

Thanks!
remarks:
2018-Oct-01 14:40:39 by tlmiller:
Looking at the submit code: 

#define SUBMIT_KEY_SuccessExitCode "success_exit_code"
....
#define ATTR_JOB_SUCCESS_EXIT_CODE "JobSuccessExitCode"
....
AssignJobVal(ATTR_JOB_SUCCESS_EXIT_CODE, success_code);

and at the email code: 

Email::shouldSend( ClassAd* ad, int exit_reason, bool is_error ) {
....
ad->LookupInteger( ATTR_JOB_NOTIFICATION, notification );
switch( notification ) {
....
        case NOTIFY_ERROR:
....
            ad->LookupInteger( ATTR_ON_EXIT_CODE, exitCode );
            ad->LookupInteger( ATTR_JOB_SUCCESS_EXIT_CODE, successExitCode );
            if( exitCode != successExitCode ) {
                return true;
            }

as of the 8.7.10 branch, and it looks like this should all work, and indeed a quick test with a sleep job shows 'JobSuccessExitCode' showing up in both condor_q and condor_history.

The code from shouldSend() dates back to 8.7.7, and the code for success_exit_code to at least as far back as 8.5.8 (?!), so I'm not sure why you're not seeing anything.

2018-Oct-01 14:50:41 by tlmiller:
Based on a review of the code, the documentation should read something like the following: 

Owners of HTCondor jobs are notified by e-mail when certain events occur.
If \SubmitCmd{notification} is \Arg{Always}...
If \SubmitCmd{notification} is \Arg{Complete}...
....
If \SubmitCmd{notification} is \Arg{Error}, the owner will be notified if:
* the job dumped core;
* the job exited by a signal;
* the job went on hold (but not if: the user requested it, the job was submitted on hold, or the job was held by its own policy expressions);
* or the job terminated with an unexpected exit code (0, unless set otherwise by \SubmitCmd{success_exit_code} or the job ad attribute \Attr{JobSuccessExitCode}).

2018-Oct-01 14:55:02 by tlmiller:
This text needs to be corrected in both man-pages/submitcmds.tex and admin-man/configure.tex (where the inline copy should probably be replaced with the appropriate reference).

We also need to add JobSuccessExitCode to misc/jobad.tex.

2018-Oct-01 15:05:12 by gthain:
note that if you set

success_exit_code = 0

We don't set JobSuccessExitCode. I would classify that as a bug.

2018-Oct-02 11:45:34 by tpdownes:

2018-Oct-02 12:01:59 by tpdownes:
Just for coolness factor, job transforms are great when you are in a mixed 8.6/8.7 environment: 

So, it would be good if you could do this so that folks can get “notification = error” behavior that they expect. Reed isn’t the first one to be confused.
JOB_TRANSFORM_NAMES = $(JOB_TRANSFORM_NAMES) HackErrorNotifications
JOB_TRANSFORM_HackErrorNotifications @=end
[
Requirements = JobNotification == 3;
set_JobNotification = IfThenElse(ExitCode isnt undefined && ExitCode=!=0, 2,3);
]
@end
